data.name: ChangeDirectoryCommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Append the given directory to the currently selected path, or move up a path when using `cd ..`

data.name: ChangeDirectoryCommand_Warning_UnknownEndpoint
data.value: Warning: The '{0}' endpoint is not present in the OpenAPI description
data.comment: {0} is the path to the referenced endpoint

data.name: ClearCommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Removes all text from the shell

data.name: EchoCommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Turns request echoing on or off, show the request that was made when using request commands

data.name: Error_NoBasePath
data.value: The base address must be set before issuing requests to a relative path. Use the `connect` command to set the base address and then try again. Type `help connect` for more information on the `connect` command.
data.comment: Error shown in console when issuing an HTTP command without first setting the base url

data.name: Error_OutputRedirected
data.value: Cannot start the REPL when output is being redirected

data.name: ExitCommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Exit the shell

data.name: Help_Arguments
data.value: Arguments:

data.name: Help_BaseAddress
data.value: {0} - The initial base address for the REPL.
data.comment: {0} is the <BASE_ADDRESS> syntax specifier

data.name: Help_Help
data.value: {0} - Show help information.
data.comment: {0} is the --help syntax specifier

data.name: Help_Options
data.value: Options:

data.name: Help_REPLCommands
data.value: Once the REPL starts, these commands are valid:

data.value: Usage:

data.name: ListCommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Show all endpoints for the current path

data.name: PrefCommand_Error_NoConfiguredValue
data.value: {0} does not have a configured value
data.comment: {0} is the name of the requested preference

data.name: PrefCommand_Error_NoGetOrSet
data.value: Whether to get or set a preference must be specified

data.name: PrefCommand_Error_NoPreferenceName
data.value: The preference to set must be specified

data.name: PrefCommand_Error_Saving
data.value: Error saving preferences

data.name: PrefCommand_Get_ConfiguredValue
data.value: Configured value: {0}
data.comment: {0} is the value of the specified preference

data.name: PrefCommand_HelpDetails_CurrentPreferences
data.value: Current Preferences:

data.name: PrefCommand_HelpDetails_DefaultPreferences
data.value: Current Default Preferences:

data.name: PrefCommand_HelpDetails_GetSyntax
data.value: {0} - Gets the value of the specified preference or lists all preferences if no preference is specified
data.comment: {0} is the get command syntax

data.name: PrefCommand_HelpDetails_SetSyntax
data.value: {0} - Sets (or clears if value is not specified) the value of the specified preference
data.comment: {0} is the set command syntax

data.name: PrefCommand_HelpDetails_Syntax
data.value: {0} - Get or sets a preference to a particular value
data.comment: {0} is the overall command syntax

data.name: PrefCommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Allows viewing or changing preferences, e.g. 'pref set editor.command.default 'C:\\Program Files\\Microsoft VS Code\\Code.exe'`

data.name: RunCommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Runs the script at the given path. A script is a set of commands that can be typed with one command per line

data.name: SetHeaderCommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Sets or clears a header for all requests. e.g. `set header content-type application/json`

data.name: UICommand_HelpSummary
data.value: Displays the Swagger UI page, if available, in the default browser

data.name: UICommand_Description
data.value: Launches the Swagger UI page (if available) in the default browser

data.name: UICommand_NotConnectedToServerError
data.value: Must be connected to a server to launch Swagger UI

data.name: UICommand_UnableToLaunchUriError
data.value: Unable to launch {0}
data.comment: {0} indicates a uri

data.name: Usage
data.value: Usage:

data.name: SetHeaderCommand_HelpDetails
data.value: Sets or clears a header. When [value] is empty the header is cleared.

data.name: RunCommand_HelpDetails
RunCommand_CouldNotFindScriptFile
data.value: Could not find script file {0}
data.comment: {0} indicates path to provided script file

data.name: HttpState_Error_NoAbsoluteUriNoBaseAddress
data.value: If {0} is not an absolute URI, {1} must be specified.
data.comment: {0} is the name of the commandSpecifiedPath parameter, {1} is the name of the baseAddress uri parameter

data.name: ListCommand_Error_NoBaseAddress
data.value: No base address has been set, so there is nothing to list. Use the `connect` command to set the base address and then try again. Type `help connect` for more information on the `connect` command.

data.name: ListCommand_Error_NoDirectoryStructure
data.value: No directory structure has been set, so there is nothing to list. Use the "connect" command to set a directory structure based on an OpenAPI description.

data.name: ConnectCommand_Error_InvalidBase
data.value: The base address must be a valid absolute url or relative url. If it is a relative url, the root address must be specified

data.name: ConnectCommand_Error_InvalidSwagger
data.value: The OpenAPI description address must be a valid absolute url or relative url. If it is a relative url, the root address must be specified

data.name: ConnectCommand_Error_NoRootNoAbsoluteBase
data.value: If no root address is specified, the base address must be an absolute url, including scheme

data.name: ConnectCommand_Error_NoRootNoAbsoluteSwagger
data.value: If no root address is specified, the OpenAPI description address must be an absolute url, including scheme

data.name: ConnectCommand_Error_NothingSpecified
data.value: You must specify either a root address or a base address and an OpenAPI description address

data.name: ConnectCommand_Error_RootAddressNotValid
data.value: If specified, the root address must be a valid absolute url, including scheme

data.name: ConnectCommand_Status_Base
data.value: Using a base address of {0}
data.comment: {0} indicates a uri

data.name: ConnectCommand_Status_NoBase
data.value: Unable to determine a base address

data.name: ConnectCommand_Status_Swagger
data.value: Using OpenAPI description at {0}
data.comment: {0} indicates a uri

data.name: ConnectCommand_Status_NoSwagger
data.value: Unable to find an OpenAPI description

data.name: ConnectCommand_Description
data.value: Configures the directory structure and base address of the api server

data.name: ConnectCommand_HelpDetails_Line1
data.value:
Configures the directory structure and base address of the api server based on the arguments and options specified. At least one of [rootAddress], [--base baseAddress] or [--openapi openApiDescriptionAddress] must be specified
By default, existing headers set via the `set header` command and path segments beyond the base address are cleared when this command is executed. Use [--persist-headers] and [--persist-paths] to change those defaults

data.name: ConnectCommand_HelpDetails_Line2
data.value: [rootAddress] will be used to automatically determine the base address and OpenAPI description address

data.name: ConnectCommand_HelpDetails_Line3
data.value: [--base baseAddress] and [--openapi openApiDescriptionAddress] allow you to explicitly set those addresses and skip auto detection

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_CustomizationCommands
data.value: REPL Customization Commands:

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_CustomizationCommands_Description
data.value: Use these commands to customize the REPL behavior

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_Details_Line1
data.value: Use `help <COMMAND>` for more detail on an individual command. e.g. `help get`

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_Details_Line2
data.value: For detailed tool info, see https://aka.ms/http-repl-doc

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_HttpCommands
data.value: HTTP Commands:

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_HttpCommands_Description
data.value: Use these commands to execute requests against your application

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_NavigationCommands
data.value: Navigation Commands:

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_NavigationCommands_Description
data.value: The REPL allows you to navigate your URL space and focus on specific APIs that you are working on

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_SetupCommands
data.value: Setup Commands:

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_SetupCommands_Description
data.value: Use these commands to configure the tool for your API server

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_ShellCommands
data.value: Shell Commands:

data.name: HelpCommand_Core_ShellCommands_Description
data.value: Use these commands to interact with the REPL shell

data.name: RealFileSystem_Error_InvalidExtension
data.value: If specified, {0} must begin with a period and have at least one character after the period.
data.comment: {0} is the parameter name

data.name: UICommand_InvalidParameter
data.value: The parameter '{0}' could not be converted into a valid uri.
data.comment: {0} is a string parameter to the UI command

data.name: UICommand_HelpText_Line1
data.value: The {0} command uses multiple sources to determine the Swagger UI endpoint. In order of precedence:
data.comment: {0} is the name of the ui command (ui)

data.name: UICommand_HelpText_Line2
data.value: 1. The {0} parameter, if specified
data.comment: {0} is the syntax for the parameter, e.g. {swaggerUIAddress}

data.name: UICommand_HelpText_Line3
data.value: 2. The {0} preference, if set
data.comment: {0} is the name of the preference, e.g. swagger.uiEndpoint

data.name: UICommand_HelpText_Line4
data.value: 3. A default URL of {0}
data.comment: {0} is the default address, e.g. [BaseAddress]/swagger

data.name: BaseHttpCommand_Error_HeaderFormatting
data.value: Headers must be formatted as {header}={value} or {header}:{value}

data.name: BaseHttpCommand_FormatBodyAsync_Streaming
data.value: Streaming the response, press any key to stop...

data.name: EchoCommand_Error_AllowedModes
data.value: Allowed echo modes are 'on' and 'off'

data.name: Options
data.value: Options:

data.name: BaseHttpCommand_Error_ContentFileDoesNotExist
data.value: The specified content file, "{0}", does not exist.
data.comment: {0} is the user supplied content file path

data.name: BaseHttpCommand_Error_DefaultEditorDoesNotExist
data.value: The specified default editor path, "{0}", does not exist.
data.comment: {0} is the user supplied default editor preference value

data.name: BaseHttpCommand_Error_DefaultEditorNotConfigured
data.value: The default editor must be configured using the command `pref set {0} "{{commandLine}}"`.
data.comment: {0} is the name of the default editor preference

data.name: Telemetry_WelcomeMessage
data.value:
Welcome to HttpRepl {0}! ------------------------
Telemetry --------- The .NET tools collect usage data in order to help us improve your experience. The data is collected by Microsoft and shared with the community. You can opt-out of telemetry by setting the DOTNET_HTTPREPL_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT environment variable to '1' or 'true' using your favorite shell.
Read more about HttpRepl telemetry: https://aka.ms/httprepl-telemetry Read more about .NET CLI Tools telemetry: https://aka.ms/dotnet-cli-telemetry
data.comment: {0} is the major.minor version of the current build

data.value: Accepts:

data.name: ListCommand_AvailableMethods
data.value: Available methods:

data.value: If your default editor is Visual Studio Code, you should set the default command arguments (`{0}`) to include `-w` or `--wait` to ensure proper integration between HttpRepl and Visual Studio Code.
data.comment: {0} indicates the preference name for the default editor arguments

data.value: Unable to locate any help information for the specified command

data.value: [--verbose] provides more detail about OpenAPI Description discovery and parsing
